questions.question: In the design process, which step comes first?
What does SWOT stand for?
A designer must consider the appropriateness of the design. It must be suitable for the:
Qualitative data uses:
Which type of sketch is shaded and coloured in full colour?
Whose theory does this pyramid belong to?
Aesthetics refer to:
What is one of the biggest obstacles you'll face as a Design and Technology teacher?

choices.answer: Helping students come up with ideas
Getting technology to work when you need it to

questions.question: Which of the following is not a product?
According to the Stage 5 Design and Tech syllabus, social and environmental issues include:

choices.answer: Individudal needs, equity and marriage equality

questions.question: Which of the following is a defining characteristic of an entrepreneur?
Which of the following is most important to the success of a product?
A life cycle analysis of a product is conducted to determine:

choices.answer: The cost of distribution and transport
The impact of the product on society and the environment
How materials will be disposed of or recycled

questions.question: A client’s brief to a designer mainly outlines:

choices.answer: A summary of all constraints to be considered in the design
A list of important social and environmental considerations
A list of consumer demands and budget targets

questions.question: Why is it important for designers to protect their intellectual property?

choices.answer: It allows competing designers to share ideas
It enables their ideas to be marketed on a global scale
It ensures that all future designs are successfully patented
It ensures that designer’s ideas cannot be sold by others

questions.question: What is the main reason for developing a working prototype?

choices.answer: To evaluate operational/functional aspects of the product
To produce a model suitable for advertising on social media
To assist companies in developing a sustainable process
To determine aesthetic requirements necessary for production

questions.question: Which of the following is most important in determining the effectiveness of a design?

choices.answer: The values and beliefs of the designer
The level of skill and resources available
The design meeting the required end-use
The use of integrated elements and principles of design

questions.question: Which of the following describes a designer with an ethical approach to designing a product?

choices.answer: Designing products that meet a niche market
Creating products that avoid excessive resource consumption
Examining procedures that protect design ideas

questions.question: Effective product development relies mainly upon:

choices.answer: The ability of designers to sketch original ideas
The ability of designers to manage financial issues
Gathering ongoing evaluation and responding to feedback

questions.question: Which of the following best indicates that a product is becoming obsolete?

choices.answer: When innovative design features are incorporated
When the product has been superseded by a newer design
When there is a decrease in the product’s sales and turnover
When the product undergoes modifications to improve function
